info.guardianproject.netcipher.client

Class StrongBuilderBase<T extends StrongBuilderBase,C>

  • java.lang.Object
    • info.guardianproject.netcipher.client.StrongBuilderBase<T,C>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    StrongBuilder<T,C>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    StrongConnectionBuilder

    public abstract class StrongBuilderBase<T extends StrongBuilderBase,C>
extends java.lang.Object
implements StrongBuilder<T,C>
    Builds an HttpUrlConnection that connects via Tor through Orbot.

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Method Detail

      • get

        protected abstract java.lang.String get(android.content.Intent status,
                                        C connection,
                                        java.lang.String url)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Performs an HTTP GET request using the supplied connection to a supplied URL, returning the String response or throws an Exception (e.g., cannot reach the server). This is used as part of validating the Tor connection.
        Parameters:
        status - the status Intent we got back from Orbot
        connection - a connection of the type for the builder
        url - an public Web page
        Returns:
        the String response from the GET request
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • withBestProxy

        public T withBestProxy()
        Call this to configure the Tor proxy from the results returned by Orbot, using the best available proxy (SOCKS if possible, else HTTP)

      • withWeakCiphers

        public T withWeakCiphers()
        Call this if you want a weaker set of supported ciphers, because you are running into compatibility problems with some server due to a cipher mismatch. The better solution is to fix the server.
        Specified by:
        withWeakCiphers in interface StrongBuilder<T extends StrongBuilderBase,C>
        Returns:
        the builder

      • withTorValidation

        public T withTorValidation()
        Call this if you want the builder to confirm that we are communicating over Tor, by reaching out to a Tor test server and confirming our connection status. By default, this is skipped. Adding this check adds security, but it has the chance of false negatives (e.g., we cannot reach that Tor server for some reason).
        Specified by:
        withTorValidation in interface StrongBuilder<T extends StrongBuilderBase,C>
        Returns:
        the builder

      • build

        public void build(StrongBuilder.Callback<C> callback)
        Description copied from interface: StrongBuilder
        Asynchronous version of build(), one that uses OrbotInitializer internally to get the status and checks the validity of the Tor connection (if requested). Note that your callback methods may be invoked on any thread; do not assume that they will be called on any particular thread.
        Specified by:
        build in interface StrongBuilder<T extends StrongBuilderBase,C>
        Parameters:
        callback - Callback to get a connection handed to you for use, already set up for NetCipher
